docs.title: About Me
docs.text: Hi, My name is Quincy Tejada, I’m an Electrical Engineer at Ivy Biomedical Systems and a 2025 UConn graduate. This site is my central hub: a place to organize what I learn, showcase the projects I build, and share lessons so others can learn from them too.

docs.title: What you’ll find here
docs.text:
• Project Demonstrations: Firmware and Hardware builds, PCB photos, fab files, and code.
  • Encyclopedia: my running notes on electronics, embedded software, and PCB layout. What worked, what didn’t, and why.

docs.title: Current focus
docs.text: I’m sharpening my circuit design and PCB layout skills—getting faster, cleaner, and more reliable with every revision.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• GitHub: https://github.com/Qtejada
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/quincy-tejada
  • YouTube: Coming Soon

Thanks for visiting—hope you find something useful here!

docs.title: About Me
docs.text: Hi, My name is Quincy Tejada, I’m an Electrical Engineer at Ivy Biomedical Systems and a 2025 UConn graduate. This site is my central hub: a place to organize what I learn, showcase the projects I build, and share lessons so others can learn from them too.

docs.title: What you’ll find here
docs.text:
• Project Demonstrations: Firmware and Hardware builds, PCB photos, fab files, and code.
  • Encyclopedia: my running notes on electronics, embedded software, and PCB layout. What worked, what didn’t, and why.

docs.title: Current focus
docs.text: I’m sharpening my circuit design and PCB layout skills—getting faster, cleaner, and more reliable with every revision.

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
• GitHub: https://github.com/Qtejada
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/quincy-tejada
  • YouTube: Coming Soon

Thanks for visiting—hope you find something useful here!

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text: Foundational EE topics and component selection.

docs.title: Capacitors
docs.text:
• MLCC derating curves.
  • ESR, ripple current, dielectric choices.

docs.title: Diodes
docs.text: • Schottky vs ultrafast; reverse recovery.

docs.title: Inductors
docs.text:
• L value, Isat, DCR tradeoffs.
  • Core materials.

docs.title: Resistors
docs.text:
• Series/parallel math.
  • Power rating & derating.
  • Tolerances, tempco.

docs.title: Transformers
docs.text: • Flyback vs forward basics.

docs.title: ADCs
docs.text: • Input sampling cap, source impedance, ENOB.

docs.title: DACs
docs.text: • Reference selection, glitch impulse.

docs.title: PCB Layout
docs.text:
• Grounding strategy, layer stacks, return paths.
  • Controlled impedance and diff pairs.

docs.title: High‑speed Notes
docs.text: • Length matching, via stubs, SI basics.

docs.title: Phil's Lab Notes
docs.text: • Personal notes from course material. Keep private segments out of repo if required.

docs.title: Planes & Return Paths
docs.text: • Split planes cautions; stitching vias.

docs.title: Traces & Impedance
docs.text: • Microstrip/stripline, calculators, impedance control.

docs.title: Buck‑Boost Converters
docs.text: • Topologies and control modes.

docs.title: Buck Converters
docs.text: • CCM/DCM, layout for switch node, compensation.

docs.title: LDOs
docs.text: • Dropout, PSRR vs frequency, stability regions.

docs.title: Software
docs.text: Curated notes on C/C++, FreeRTOS, and IoT stacks (BLE/Wi‑Fi/802.x).

docs.title: C / C++
docs.text:
• Build systems: CMake, Make.
  • Memory model on MCUs; volatile; const-correctness.
  • Bare-metal startup (reset vector, .data/.bss init, libc stubs).

docs.title: FreeRTOS
docs.text:
• Task design patterns, priorities, and inversion.
  • Queues, semaphores, and event groups.
  • Tick vs tickless idle.

docs.title: BLE
docs.text:
• GAP/GATT basics.
  • Connection intervals, PHYs, MTU.

docs.title: 802.x
docs.text: • 802.15.4, Thread, Zigbee; LPWAN overview.

docs.title: Wi‑Fi
docs.text: • 802.11 PHY/MAC, security, power save.

docs.title: Project Demonstration
docs.text: • :material-chip: LED Blinker (STM32) Basic timer + GPIO project. :octicons-arrow-right-24: View

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Minimal timer-driven LED blink on STM32. Includes schematics snapshot, firmware outline, and fab outputs.

docs.title: Files
docs.text:
• Download fab outputs: Gerbers ZIP
  • Download firmware bundle: Firmware ZIP

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Clock: HSI @ 16 MHz, APB prescalers default.
  • Timer: TIM2 at 1 Hz interrupt -> toggles LED GPIO.
  • Toolchain: GCC + CMake; or CubeIDE.
